episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the mystery of ancient Rome's secret name, the unique sound of a Jaguar car, Queen Elizabeth I's preference for bear-baiting over Shakespeare, and the Edwardian practice of ordering seawater for health benefits.

facts.fact: Ancient Rome had a secret name, and no one knows what it was to this very day.
In 2010, Jaguar made a car that sounded like an actual Jaguar.
Queen Elizabeth I never visited Shakespeare's Globe; however, she did visit a venue down the road to watch bears fighting a dog and monkey.
In Edwardian times, you could order a barrel of seawater to be delivered to your inland home so you could keep on enjoying the health benefits of your holiday after it ended.
